comments:
when the compiler warning 'Serializable class without SerialVersionUI' is 
enabled and the quick fix 'Add Generated serialversionid' is used, a dialog 
with title 'Java Virtual Machine Launcher' with message 'Fatal exception 
occurred. Program will exit.' appears, and the default 1L is inserted instead.

Frank,

any steps to reproduce this. And which build are you using.

From the log file:

eclipse.buildId=I20041216-2000
java.runtime.name=Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition
java.runtime.version=1.5.0_01-b08


I can't reproduce it on a simple Serializable for some reason, but it keeps 
happening on the objects I need it for, which are part of a plugin project.
I'll try to isolate.

still pops up the dialog about the fatal error, but it inserts a number that 
seems valid, or at least similar to the tests I did in simplified environments.
